intro: Agalma vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Agalma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
